SEARCH
Package sprouts

Interface Viewables<T>

Type Parameters:
T - The type of the items held by this Vals.
All Superinterfaces:
Iterable<T>, Observable, Vals<T>
public interface Viewables<T> extends Vals<T>, Observable
A read-only live view on a delegated list of items which can be observed for changes using Actions registered through the onChange(Action) method. This is a list of properties which are observed together and fire a single event when any of them changes.

The API of this is very similar to the Vals API in the sense that it is a list of properties which may also be empty. However, this interface extends the Observable interface to allow registering Actions which will be called when the list of properties is shown (which is called when its state changes).

If you no longer need to observe changes on this list of properties, then you can remove the registered Action callback using the Observable.unsubscribe(Subscriber) method (Action is also a Subscriber).

Instances of this are intended to be created from Vals property lists. Viewables created from a property list is weakly referenced by said property list. You can register change listeners on it, and when you no longer want changes to be propagated to the Viewables, then you can simply drop its reference, and it will be garbage collected alongside all of its change listeners.

See Also:
  • A super type of this class with a read-only API.
  • A mutable property API and subtype of Vals.
  • A single property with a similar API to this one.
  • The interface which this extends to allow registering Actions.

  • Method Details

    • cast

      static <T> Viewables<T> cast(Vals<T> vals)
      Regular properties, created from the various factory methods in Vals and Vars, (may) also implement the Viewables interface internally.
      Although Vals and Vars do not extend Viewables directly, you may cast them to a Viewables to get access to the Viewables API.

      This method is a convenience method which allows you to cast the given Vals instance to a Viewables.
      The main intention of this method is to allow you to register change listeners on the given Vals instance, which will be called whenever the items viewed by this Viewables changes after operations to the source property list.

      WARNING: The change listeners registered on the cast property list will not be garbage collected automatically. You must remove them manually when no longer needed.

      If you want to protect yourself from memory leaks caused by change listeners, create a Viewables instance through the Vals.view() method, and register change listeners on that instance instead.
      The Viewables instance created through the Vals.view() method will be garbage collected automatically when no longer needed, and all change listeners registered on it will be removed automatically.

      Type Parameters:
      T - The type of the item held by the Vals instance.
      Parameters:
      vals - The Vals instance to cast to a Viewables.
      Returns:
      The supplied Vals instance cast to a Viewables instance.

    • onChange

      Vals<T> onChange(Action<ValsDelegate<T>> action)
      Similar to Viewable.onChange(Channel, Action) but for a list of properties.
      Parameters:
      action - The action to perform when the list of properties is shown (which is called when its state changes).
      Returns:
      This list of properties.
